items.Justification: This article discusses exoplanet detection with JWST, which is not directly relevant to FSOC or adaptive optics.
Similar to the previous article, this one focuses on high mass transiting exoplanets and brown dwarfs, not FSOC or adaptive optics.
This article presents an experimental demonstration of photonic phase correctors, which is directly relevant to the researcher's interests in adaptive optics and FSOC.
This article discusses light scrambling and focal ratio degradation of thin multimode fibers, which is somewhat related to FSOC but not directly to the researcher's specific interests.
This article presents an on-sky demonstration of an ultra-fast intensity interferometry instrument, which is not directly relevant to FSOC or adaptive optics.
